abstract: <jats:p>The genus <jats:italic>Orbamia</jats:italic> Herbulot, 1966 is revised. Two new genera are described: <jats:italic>Rabomia</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>gen. nov.</jats:bold> (type species: Ectropis ? subaurata Warren, 1899), and <jats:italic>Morabia</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>gen. nov.</jats:bold> (type species: <jats:italic>Morabia politzari</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>). Ten new species and two new subspecies are described: <jats:italic>Rabomia obscurior</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, from western Africa, <jats:italic>Morabia politzari</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, from Kenya, <jats:italic>Morabia brunnea</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, from Zambia, <jats:italic>Orbamia marginata</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, from Tanzania, <jats:italic>Orbamia clarissima</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, from Kenya, <jats:italic>Orbamia clarior</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, from Kenya, <jats:italic>Orbamia obliqua</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, from Zambia, <jats:italic>Orbamia obliqua parva</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>subsp. nov.</jats:bold>, from South Africa, <jats:italic>Orbamia abiyi</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, from Zambia, Tanzania, Ethiopia, <jats:italic>Orbamia emanai</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, from Ethiopia, <jats:italic>Orbamia emanai lenzi</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>subsp. nov.</jats:bold>, from Zambia and Malawi, and <jats:italic>Orbamia balensis</jats:italic> Hausmann &amp; Tujuba, <jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold> from Ethiopia. The taxon <jats:italic>Lepiodes ocellata</jats:italic> Warren, 1897 is raised from synonymy of <jats:italic>O. octomaculata</jats:italic> (Wallengren, 1872) to species rank (Zambia, Tanzania, Rwanda). The taxonomical analysis is based on both morphological and genetic cytochrome oxidase I (COI) data. Adults and male and female genitalia of all species are illustrated.</jats:p>
title: Revision of the Orbamia Herbulot, 1966 group of genera with description of two new genera, ten new species, and two new subspecies (Lepidoptera, Geometridae, Ennominae, Cassymini)

reference.article-title: New World geometrid moths (Lepidoptera: Geometridae): Molecular phylogeny, biogeography, taxonomic updates and description of 11 new tribes.
